item.title: Fitting a curve to data LOWESS and LOESS
item.description: body { text-align: justify} This article is a summary of the StatQuest video made by Josh Starmer. Click here to see the video explained by Josh Starmer. Locally weighted regression scatterplot smoothing - LOWESS The main idea to fit a curve to data point is to use a type of sliding window to divide the data into smaller blobs. The second main idea is that each data point use the least squares to fit a line.
